text: Len Barry (born Leonard Borisoff; June 12, 1942 â€“ November 5, 2020) was an American singer-songwriter and record producer. Performing with The Dovells, he was known for singing "Bristol Stomp" and "1-2-3". On June 25, 2019, The New York Times Magazine listed Len Barry among hundreds of artists whose material was reportedly destroyed in the 2008 Universal fire. Barry died on November 5, 2020 at a hospital in Philadelphia from myelodysplastic syndrome, aged 78. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from myelodysplastic syndrome Category:American soul singers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American record producers Category:Singers from Philadelphia Category:Businesspeople from Philadelphia Category:Writers from Philadelphia
title: Len Barry
